intro: Calea leptocephala, commonly known as the "soul of the forest," is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble small, delicate flowers. Calea leptocephala thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
